SEARCH
Package gw.cc.exposure.entity

Interface Exposure

All Superinterfaces:
com.guidewire.cc.domain.claim.ClaimContactRoleOwner, ClaimContactRoleOwner, com.guidewire.cc.domain.contact.EntityContactRoleOwner
public interface Exposure extends com.guidewire.cc.domain.claim.ClaimContactRoleOwner
Exposure An exposure is a discrete piece of a claim that involves a single type of loss (for example, vehicle damage or bodily injury) to a specific claimant.

  • Field Details

    • finder

      static final PublicExposureFinder finder

  • Method Details

    • getTypedIncident

      Object getTypedIncident(String typeName)
      Implements type safe properties for accessing incident subtypes; for example you can use VehicleIncident to access the incident as a VehicleIncident (providing it really is a VehicleIncident). This method returns null if the type is not a supertype of the actual incident type, or if the incident is null.
      Parameters:
      typeName - the supertype to attempt to access the incident as
      Returns:
      the incident, or null if typeName is not a supertype of the actual incident type or if the incident is null

    • setTypedIncident

      void setTypedIncident(String typeName, Object value)
      Implements type safe properties for accessing incident subtypes; for example VehicleIncident can be used to access the incident as a VehicleIncident (providing it really is a VehicleIncident!). Throws illegal argument exception if the named type is not the type required for the current exposure type. Note that the setter has to be stricter than the getter. You can get an incident and treat it as a supertype. But when setting an incident its type must be exactly the type required by the exposure type.
      Parameters:
      typeName - the incident type (not used)
      value - incident to attempt to set

    • getClaimantDenormForExposure

      Contact getClaimantDenormForExposure()
      Gets the exposure's claimant using the denormalized fields-- first checks the exposure's getClaimantDenorm() method, and if that returns null checks the claim's getClaimantDenorm() method. Does not check the claim type before attempting to return the claim.ClaimantDenorm value.
      Returns:
      the denormalized claimant field, or null if none

    • segment

      void segment()
      Apply segmentation to this exposure. (This does both segmentation and strategy.) If all exposures on the claim are being segmented, consider using Claim.segmentAllExposures() for performance and caching.

    • createWorkplan

      void createWorkplan()
      Executes a rule set (synchronously) to generate a workplan for this exposure.

    • isValid

      boolean isValid(ValidationLevel level)
      Returns whether this exposure is valid at the specified level.
      Parameters:
      level - the level to check.
      Returns:
      true if this exposure is valid to at least the specified level

      Parameters:

      Returns:

      void close(ExposureClosedOutcomeType outcome, String reason) throws com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.CloseException, EntityValidationException
      Closes the exposure and zeros out the exposure's open reserves.
      Parameters:

      Throws:
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.CloseException

      Reopens the exposure.
      Parameters:

      reason - a string indicating the reason for which this exposure is being reopened
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.ReopenException
      EntityValidationException

    • getPossibleCoverageTypes

      CoverageType[] getPossibleCoverageTypes()
      Returns an array containing the possible coverage types for this exposure, given the claim's policy type and this exposure's own type. The line of business configuration (see the BusinessLineConfiguration entity) restricts the possible choices. This method also excludes any coverage types that do not have any suitable coverage subtypes. This method is useful in the UI when presenting the user with a range of choices for setting an exposure's coverage type.
      Returns:
      the array of possible coverage types, or an empty array if there are none. Never returns null

    • getPossibleCoverageSubtypes

      CoverageSubtype[] getPossibleCoverageSubtypes(CoverageType coverageType)

      Returns an array containing the possible coverage subtypes for this exposure if the coverage type is set to the given value. Takes into account the exposure's type and excludes any coverage subtypes not available for this exposure's type. The coverage type is exposed as a parameter (rather than just being the current PrimaryCoverage value).

      You can use this method to ask "if the coverage type of this exposure was X, what subtypes are possible?". This may be useful in the UI for constructing reflection value ranges. For example, if the user selects a particular coverage type you can set the choice of coverage subtypes appropriately via reflection.

      Parameters:
      coverageType - the proposed coverage type. To use the current coverage type just use the result of Exposure.getPrimaryCoverage().
      Returns:
      the array of possible coverage subtypes, or an empty array if there are none or if the coverageType parameter is null. Never returns null.

    • saveAndSetup

      void saveAndSetup()
      Same as saveAndSetup(gw.api.assignment.Assignee), except it auto assigns the exposure.

    • saveAndSetup

      void saveAndSetup(Assignee assignee)

      Does all preprocessing work required to save an exposure, and then saves it. saveAndSetup performs the following steps:

      1. Sets the Exposure's claim order.
      2. Runs the "Pre-assign" ruleset on the exposure.
      3. Runs the segmentation engine on the exposure.
      4. Runs the strategy engine on the exposure.
      5. Runs the assignment engine on the exposure.
      6. Runs the workplan engine on the exposure.
      7. Runs the "Post-assign" ruleset on the exposure.
      8. Sets the exposure's status to "open".
      9. Create initial reserves.
      10. Commits the exposures's bundle (which will contain the exposure, activities, and other objects creating during the call).
      Parameters:
      assignee - the target assignee to which the exposure should be assigned

    • validate

      ValidationResult validate(boolean validateClaim)
      Executes new exposure validation rules on the exposure, and returns a validation object containing any errors (if validation was successful, an empty validation object is returned). Note that this method has the side-effect of setting the validation level, and hence requires that the current user have Claim EDIT permissions, or will throw an exception.
      Parameters:
      validateClaim - Whether or not the exposure's claim should be validated as well. If true then the claim is validated before the exposure is validated.
      Returns:
      a ValidationResult containing 0 or more errors found.

    • canClose

      boolean canClose(User user)
      Returns true if this exposure in the open state, has no awaiting submission, future payments tied to it, and the specified user has permission to close it.
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose permissions should be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the specified user can close this exposure.

    • canReopen

      boolean canReopen(User user)

      Returns true if the specified user can re-open this exposure.

      This is only true if:
      • this exposure is currently closed
      • the claim is currently open
      • the user has permission to reopen the exposure
      Parameters:
      user - The user whose permissions to check.
      Returns:
      true iff the specified user can re-open this exposure.

    • getClaimCurrency

      Currency getClaimCurrency()
      Returns the Currency of this Exposure's associated Claim.
      Returns:
      The currency of the associated Claim, as an element of the Currency typelist. Returns NULL if the Claim is currently unreachable (if, for example, the necessary entity connections have not yet been made).

    • isPaymentAllowed

      boolean isPaymentAllowed()
      Returns true if a payment can be made against this exposure. Specifically, returns true if:
      • Exposure is closed and previous payments have been made on it.
      • Exposure is open and global PaymentExceedsReserves = true.
      • Exposure is open and no reserves have been created for the exposure.
      • Exposure is open and has available reserves.
      Returns:
      true if a payment can be made against this exposure, false otherwise

    • hasPayment

      boolean hasPayment(TransactionSet transactionSet, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory)
      Returns true if this exposure has a Payment that matches the given cost type and cost category and if the given TransactionSet is null, the Payment does not belong to the TransactionSet. The status and amount of the transactions are not considered.
      Parameters:
      transactionSet - TransactionSet to test whether this exposure has a Payment belongs to it.
      costType - CostType to test whether this exposure has a Payment that matches it.
      costCategory - CostCategory to test whether this exposure has a Payment that matches it.
      Returns:
      true if this exposure has a payment that matches the given cost type and cost category and does not belong to the given transaction set.

    • hasAwaitingSubmissionPaymentsForToday

      boolean hasAwaitingSubmissionPaymentsForToday()
      Tests whether this exposure has at least one payment whose status is Awaiting Submission and whose scheduled send date is today.
      Returns:
      true if the above criteria are met, else false.

    • runPreSetupRules

      Runs presetup rules on this exposure.

      Runs postsetup rules on this exposure.

    • hasServicePeriod

      boolean hasServicePeriod()
      Returns true if this exposure should have a service period associated with it (for checks). This method can return true for exposure types: WC Lost Wages, PIP, Bodily Injury, or WC Injury.
      Returns:
      true if this exposure should have a service period associated with it, false otherwise

    • newCheckCreator

      CheckCreator newCheckCreator()

    • createRecovery

      Recovery createRecovery(Contact payer, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory, RecoveryCategory recoveryCategory, LineCategory lineCategory, BigDecimal recoveryAmount, String comments, User requestingUser)
      Creates a recovery on this exposure. The recovery is created with one line item and the Claim Currency.
      Parameters:
      payer - The payer of the recovery.
      costType - The costtype for the recovery. This value cannot be null.
      costCategory - The costcategory for the recovery This value cannot be null.
      recoveryCategory - The Recovery Category for the recovery.
      lineCategory - The category for the line item. (We assume only one line item -- this is nullable.)
      recoveryAmount - The amount of the recovery line item (and therefore the recovery). The amount must be positive.
      comments - Comments on this recovery.
      requestingUser - The user requesting this recovery.
      Returns:
      the created recovery

    • createRecovery

      Recovery createRecovery(Contact payer, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory, RecoveryCategory recoveryCategory, LineCategory lineCategory, BigDecimal recoveryAmount, Currency recoveryCurrency, BigDecimal exchangeRateOverride, String customExchangeRateDescription, BigDecimal claimAmountOverride, BigDecimal reportingAmountOverride, String comments, User requestingUser)
      Creates a recovery on this exposure. The recovery is created with one line item.
      Parameters:
      payer - The payer of the recovery.
      costType - The costtype for the recovery. This value cannot be null.
      costCategory - The costcategory for the recovery This value cannot be null.
      recoveryCategory - The Recovery Category for the recovery.
      lineCategory - The category for the line item. (We assume only one line item -- this is nullable.)
      recoveryAmount - The amount of the recovery line item (and therefore the recovery). The amount must be positive.
      recoveryCurrency - The currency of the recoveryAmount.
      exchangeRateOverride - The exchange rate that is to be used to override the default rate, can be null
      customExchangeRateDescription - The custom exchange rate description, can be null
      claimAmountOverride - The claim amount to override the automatically calculated amount, can be null
      reportingAmountOverride - The reporting Amount to override, not used for now, MUST BE NULL
      comments - Comments on this recovery.
      requestingUser - The user requesting this recovery. @return the created recovery

    • canCreateReserve

      boolean canCreateReserve(User user)
      Returns whether the given user can create a reserve on this exposure.
      Parameters:
      user - the user to test whether he can create a reserve on this exposure.
      Returns:
      true if current user has reserve authority and exposure is open, false otherwise.

    • createInitialReserve

      Reserve createInitialReserve(CostType costType, CostCategory category, BigDecimal amount)
      Creates an initial reserve on this exposure. The reserve is created with one line item. The reserving currency of the new reserve is set to the claim currency. The Reserve that is returned by this method is still editable, so you can modify its Currency or other fields.

      Note: This method is only needed for rules. Specifically, it should only be used within the Initial Reserves ruleset. Note that reserves created via this method and Initial Reserves rules are not submitted for approval and hence bypass authority limit checking. They are immediately updated to Submitting status.

      Parameters:
      costType - The cost type for the reserve.
      category - The cost category for the reserve.
      amount - The amount of the reserve line item (and therefore the reserve).
      Returns:
      the newly created Reserve transaction

    • calculateInitialReserve

      Reserve[] calculateInitialReserve(Key userID)
      Calculates the initial reserve on this exposure.
      Parameters:
      userID - The requesting user of the ReserveSet.
      Returns:
      the set of initial reserves created by the IInitialReserveAdapter.

    • setAvailableReserves

      Reserve setAvailableReserves(CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory, BigDecimal newReserveAmount, User submittingUser) throws com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException, com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedExposureException, com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException
      Sets the available reserves for this exposure to the given amount by creating a reserve that increases or decreases the currently available reserves. This method creates a new ReserveSet and Reserve transaction with the amount necessary to get the AvailableReserves for the matching ReserveLine to equal the newReserveAmount. This transaction amount might be positive if an increase is needed or negative if a decrease is needed. The ReserveSet is not run through pre-setup rules and is immediately submitted for approval. Unlike setting reserves in the UI, this method ignores any Reserve transactions on the same ReserveLine with a status of Pending Approval (since the AvailableReserves calculation does not include PendingApproval reserves). If the current AvailableReserves amount is already equal to newReserveAmount, then this method does not create a new Reserve nor ReserveSet, and returns null.
      Parameters:
      costType - The cost type for the reserve. This value cannot be null.
      costCategory - The cost category for the reserve. This value cannot be null.
      newReserveAmount - The amount the available reserves should be. The amount must be zero or greater, not negative.
      submittingUser - User submitting this reserve.
      Returns:
      the new reserve (Note: the amount of the returned reserve should not be changed) The method will return null if new reserve is not created.
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException - if the claim is closed (reserves cannot be created on closed claims)
      com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedExposureException - if the exposure is closed (reserves cannot be created on closed exposures)
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException - if the submitting user does not have authority to create the reserve

    • setOpenRecoveryReserves

      RecoveryReserve setOpenRecoveryReserves(CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory, RecoveryCategory recoveryCategory, BigDecimal newRecoveryReserveAmount, User submittingUser) throws com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException, com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedExposureException, com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException, com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.RecoveryReservesNotAllowedException
      Sets the open recovery reserves for this exposure to the given amount by creating a recovery reserve that increases or decreases the current open recovery reserves.
      Parameters:
      costType - The cost type for the recovery reserve. This value cannot be null.
      costCategory - The cost category for the recovery reserve. This value cannot be null.
      recoveryCategory - The recovery category for the recovery reserve. This value cannot be null.
      newRecoveryReserveAmount - The amount the open recovery reserves should be. The amount must be non-null and zero or greater, not negative.
      submittingUser - User submitting this recovery reserve.
      Returns:
      the new Recovery Reserve (Note: the amount of the returned Recovery Reserve should not be changed) The method will return null if new recoveryReserve is not created.
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedClaimException - if the claim is closed (recovery reserves cannot be created on closed claims).
      com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.ClosedExposureException - if the exposure is closed (recovery reserves cannot be created on closed exposures).
      com.guidewire.pl.system.exception.InsufficientAuthorityException - if the submitting user does not have authority to create the recovery reserve.
      com.guidewire.cc.system.exception.RecoveryReservesNotAllowedException - if the system is not configured to allow recovery reserves, i.e., the UseRecoveryReserves parameter is false.

    • hasReserve

      boolean hasReserve(TransactionSet transactionSet, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory)
      Returns true if this exposure has a Reserve that matches the given cost type and cost category and, if the given TransactionSet is not null, the Reserve does not belong to the TransactionSet. The status and amount of the transactions are not considered.
      Parameters:
      transactionSet - the TransactionSet to test whether there is a reserve belonging to it.
      costType - the CostType to test whether there is a reserve that matches it.
      costCategory - the CostCategory to test whether there is a reserve that matches it.
      Returns:
      true if this exposure has a reserve that matches the given cost type and cost category and does not belong to the given transaction set.

    • getInitialReserve

      Reserve getInitialReserve(TransactionSet transactionSet, CostType costType, CostCategory costCategory)
      Returns the initial reserve transaction of this exposure. The initial reserve is the saved reserve with a status of TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTING or TransactionStatus.TC_SUBMITTED that has the earliest update time. Excludes the transactions in the given TransactionSet if it is not null.

      Note this method only returns one reserve, though many reserve transactions may have been initially created at the same time and meet the given filter requirements. Also, this method has nothing to do with Claim Health Metrics that use a concept of initial reserves.

      This method used to return the Amount of the initial Reserve; add ".Amount" to the end to get the old return value (this is null safe in Gosu). It would also return BigDecimal.ZERO if the Amount was null, so you'll have to add a check for that null case, too. For example: 

         var amount = exposure.getInitialReserve(...).Amount
   amount = (amount == null ? BigDecimal.ZERO : amount)
      Parameters:
      transactionSet - reserves included in this TransactionSet is excluded from the determination of the initial reserve
      costType - only reserves that have this CostType are considered - if null, then all reserves are considered, regardless of CostType.
      costCategory - only reserves that have this CostCategory are considered - if null, then all reserves are considered, regardless of CostCategory.
      Returns:
      initial reserve of this exposure, or null if no match

    • getTotalRecoveries

      CurrencyAmount getTotalRecoveries()
      Return the total recoveries for this exposure.
      Returns:
      amount of total recoveries for this exposure.

    • getTransactionsIterator

      Iterator<Transaction> getTransactionsIterator(boolean newAndModifiedOnly)

      Constructs an Iterator to provide access to the transactions for this exposure. This is a more efficient alternative to calling Exposure.getTransactions(), particularly if you are only interested in new or modified transactions. You can use this method to retrieve all the Transaction objects or only the new and modified objects. If you choose to retrieve all the Transaction objects then, those transactions that were removed in the current transaction are not be returned by the Iterator.

      Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, there is no guarantee that the beans returned by this iterator may not be in the same bundle as this Exposure, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

      Parameters:
      newAndModifiedOnly - if true then only new and modified transactions for this exposure are returned. This includes transactions for which only the line items were modified. Otherwise, if false then the method returns all transactions for the exposure, including new and modified Transaction objects, but excluding deleted transactions.
      Returns:
      an Iterator that returns transactions.

    • getTransactionsQuery

      IQueryBeanResult<TransactionDefaultView> getTransactionsQuery()
      Constructs a query to use for retrieving all the transactions, regardless of subtype, for this exposure. this query is suitable for populating a list view in the user interface. The query also filters by the current user's transaction view permissions. The transactions are returned as they currently exist on the database.
      Returns:
      a QueryProcessor that encapsulates the query to return all Transaction objects for this exposure. The returned rows are actually TransactionDefaultView entities for efficiency.

    • getPaymentsIterator

      Iterator<Payment> getPaymentsIterator(boolean newAndModifiedOnly)

      Constructs an Iterator to provide access to the Payment objects for this exposure. You can choose to get either all the payments or only the new and modified payments. If you choose to get all the Payment objects, then Payment objects in the current transaction are not be returned by the Iterator. This method is a much more efficient alternative to calling Exposure.getTransactions() and iterating through all the transactions to find just the desired Payment objects.

      Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, the beans returned by this iterator are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this Exposure, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

      Parameters:
      newAndModifiedOnly - if true then only new and modified Payment objects for this exposure are returned. This includes payments for which only the line items were modified. Otherwise, if false then all Payment objects for the exposure are returned, including new and modified Payment objects, but excluding deleted Payment objects.
      Returns:
      an Iterator that returns Payment objects.

    • getPaymentsQuery

      IQueryBeanResult<PaymentView> getPaymentsQuery()
      Constructs a query to use for retrieving all the payments for this exposure. This query is suitable for populating a list view in the UI. The query also filters by the current user's transaction view permissions, so the results may be empty if the user has no payment view permissions. The payments are returned as they currently exist on the database.
      Returns:
      a QueryProcessor that encapsulates the query to return all Payment objects for this exposure. The returned rows are actually PaymentView entities for efficiency.

    • getReservesIterator

      Iterator<Reserve> getReservesIterator(boolean newAndModifiedOnly)

      Constructs an Iterator to provide access to the Reserve objects for this exposure. You can choose to retrieve either all the Reserve objects or only the new and modified reserves. If you choose to retrieve all the Reserve objects, then those Reserve objects that were removed in the current transaction are not returned by the Iterator. This method is a much more efficient alternative to calling Exposure.getTransactions() and iterating through all the transactions to find just the desired reserves.

      Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, the beans returned by this iterator are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this Exposure, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

      Parameters:
      newAndModifiedOnly - if true then only new and modified Reserve objects for this exposure will be returned. This includes reserves for which only the line items have been modified. Otherwise, if false then all Reserve objects for the exposure are returned, including new and modified Reserve objects, but excluding deleted Reserve objects.
      Returns:
      an Iterator that returns Reserve objects.

    • getReservesQuery

      IQueryBeanResult<ReserveView> getReservesQuery()
      Constructs a query to use for retrieving all the reserves for this exposure. This query is suitable for populating a list view in the UI. The query also filters by the current user's transaction view permissions, so the results may be empty if the user has no reserve view permission. The reserves are returned as they currently exist on the database.
      Returns:
      a QueryProcessor that encapsulates the query to return all Reserve objects for this exposure. The returned rows are actually ReserveView entities for efficiency.

    • getRecoveriesIterator

      Iterator<Recovery> getRecoveriesIterator(boolean newAndModifiedOnly)

      Constructs an Iterator to provide access to the Recovery objects for this exposure. You can choose to retrieve all the recoveries or only the new and modified recoveries. If you choose to retrieve all the Recovery objects, then those recoveries that were removed in the current transaction are not returned by the Iterator. This is a much more efficient alternative to calling Exposure.getTransactions() and iterating through all the transactions to find just the desired Recoveries.

      Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, the beans returned by this iterator are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this Exposure, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

      Parameters:
      newAndModifiedOnly - if true then only new and modified Recovery objects for this exposure will be returned. This includes recoveries for which only the line items have been modified. Otherwise, if false then all Recovery objects for the exposure will be returned, including new and modified Recovery objects, but excluding deleted Recovery objects.
      Returns:
      an Iterator that returns Recovery objects.

    • getRecoveriesQuery

The query also filters by the current user's transaction view permissions, so the results may be empty if the user has no recovery view permission. The recoveries are returned as they currently exist on the database.
      Returns:

    • getRecoveryReservesIterator

      Iterator<RecoveryReserve> getRecoveryReservesIterator(boolean newAndModifiedOnly)

      Constructs an Iterator to provide access to the RecoveryReserve objects for this exposure. You can choose to retrieve either all the RecoveryReserve objects or only the new and modified RecoveryReserve objects. If you choose to retrieve all the RecoveryReserve objects, then those RecoveryReserve objects that were removed in the current transaction are not be returned by the Iterator. This is a much more efficient alternative to calling Exposure.getTransactions() and iterating through all the transactions to find just the desired RecoveryReserve objects.

      Note: When newAndModifiedOnly is false, the beans returned by this iterator are not guaranteed to be in the same bundle as this Exposure, and their bundle may not be editable. To edit the beans, you should add them to an editable bundle first.

      Parameters:
      newAndModifiedOnly - if true then only new and modified RecoveryReserve objects for this exposure will be returned. This includes recovery reserves for which only the line items have been modified. Otherwise, if false then all RecoveryReserve objects for the exposure will be returned, including new and modified RecoveryReserve objects, but excluding deleted RecoveryReserve objects.
      Returns:
      an Iterator that returns Recoveries

    • getRecoveryReservesQuery

      IQueryBeanResult<RecoveryReserveView> getRecoveryReservesQuery()
      Constructs a query to use for retrieving all the RecoveryReserve objects for this exposure. this query is suitable for populating a ListView in the UI. The query also filters by the current user's transaction view permissions, so the results may be empty if the user has no RecoveryReserve objects view permission. The RecoveryReserve objects will be returned as they currently exist on the database.
      Returns:
      a QueryProcessor that encapsulates the query to return all RecoveryReserve objects for this exposure. The returned rows are actually RecoveryReserveView entities for efficiency.

    • hasPassedAbilityToPay

      boolean hasPassedAbilityToPay()
      Verifies whether this exposure has passed the ability to pay validation level and so can have a payment created against it. The verification may potentially end up performing validation of the exposure.
      Returns:
      true if this exposure has passed the "ability to pay" validation level, else false

    • isAtAbilityToPay

      boolean isAtAbilityToPay()
      Verifies whether this exposure is at the ability to pay validation level. Note: Unlike hasPassedAbilityToPay(), this API never performs validation of the exposure. It only verifies against whatever validation level that has been set currently on the exposure.
      Returns:
      true if this exposure is at the "ability to pay" validation level, else false

    • isISOEnabled

      boolean isISOEnabled()
      Returns whether this exposure is enabled for ISO. True if the exposure has any ISO status other than "Not of Interest" and the claim is ISO enabled, false otherwise
      Returns:
      true if this exposure is enabled for ISO, false otherwise.

    • getPossibleLossParties

      LossPartyType[] getPossibleLossParties()
      Returns the possible loss parties for an exposure of this type. The possible loss parties for a given exposure type are determined by type key filtering, see the LossPartyType.xml file for details. If the exposure is newly created and has no type, returns all loss party types.
      Returns:
      the possible loss parties for an exposure of this type sorted in typekey order, never null. Should not return an empty array (except, possibly, on configurations which do not use the loss party field at all).

    • newEmploymentData

      EmploymentData newEmploymentData()
      Creates a new instance of EmploymentData, populating the EmploymentData.setClaim(entity.Claim) foreign key automatically. The new instance is created in the same bundle as the exposure.
      Returns:
      The EmploymentData instance

    • newIncident

      Incident newIncident()
      Creates a suitable incident for this exposure. Also sets the incident's claim to be this exposure's claim.
      Returns:
      the new incident

    • ensureIncidentCreated

      Incident ensureIncidentCreated()
      Checks if this exposure already has an incident and creates a new one of the appropriate type if it doesn't. If it creates a new incident, sets the incident's claim to be this exposure's claim.
      Returns:
      the incident

    • getPossibleIncidents

      Incident[] getPossibleIncidents()
      Returns all incidents on this claim's exposure that could possibly be suitable for this exposure. Only incidents whose type matches the incident type configured for this exposure (see com.guidewire.cc.domain.claim.BusinessLineConfiguration.getIncidentTypeForExposureType) are returned.
      Returns:
      all incidents on the claim whose type matches the type of this exposure. Never returns null, returns the empty list if there are no incidents of the right type or if this exposure does not have a type set or has a null claim.

    • assignUserRole

      UserRoleAssignment assignUserRole(User user, Group group, UserRole role)
      Assigns the given User/Group pair to the given role on this assignable object. If the role is exclusive, replaces the existing assignment. Otherwise, adds a new assignment for the given User/Group pair, if none already exists for that role.

      group -
      role -

    • getUserRoleAssignmentByRole

      UserRoleAssignment getUserRoleAssignmentByRole(UserRole role)
      Gets the user role assignment for that role If there's no assignment for that role, returns null. If there is more than one assignment for that role, then the first role will be returned. Note: getUserRoleAssignmentsByRole(UserRole) should be called if multiple assignments are expected to return.
      Parameters:
      role - The role for the assignment

    • getOrCreateUserRoleAssignmentByRole

      UserRoleAssignment getOrCreateUserRoleAssignmentByRole(UserRole role)
      Gets the user role assignment for that role If there's no assignment for that role, creates a new one. If there is more than one assignment for that role, then the first role will be returned no matter whether the role is exclusive or not.
      Parameters:
      role - The role for the assignment
      Returns:
      the existing user role assignment if found, or a new one if not found
      See Also:
      • getUserRoleAssignmentByRole(typekey.UserRole)
